title: Floating Solar Farms Transform Reservoirs Into Power Plants
introText: Floating solar installations are transforming reservoirs and lakes into power generators while conserving water. The technology is particularly attractive in land-constrained and water-stressed regions.

content.content: Floating solar panels perform 10-15% better than land-based installations due to water cooling. They reduce evaporation, conserving billions of gallons annually in reservoir applications.
China, Japan, and South Korea lead deployment with projects exceeding 100 megawatts. California is piloting floating solar on aqueducts to address both energy and water challenges.
Floating solar avoids land-use conflicts that constrain conventional solar development. The approach is particularly valuable in densely populated regions with limited available land.
